common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties installing and using Ollama, particularly on Linux due to snap confinement issues and missing dependencies. Workarounds include manual installation, but a permanent fix involving dependency management and snap configuration is expected from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama fails to install on Ubuntu with Pieces installed as a snap.
* The problem is caused by strict confinement of the snap, which prevents access to external programs like curl.
* Users are unable to download and use local LLM models due to this issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails due to missing curl dependency.
* Strict confinement of the snap prevents access to external programs and files.
* Users are unable to download and use local LLM models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add curl as a dependency to the snap definition file.
* Modify Pieces to allow access to local LLM models within the snap environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is being developed and is expected to be released soon.
* Users can use the workaround of manually downloading and installing Ollama, but this doesn't resolve the issue completely.

**Action Needed:**

* Monitor the issue for updates and the release of the fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is impacting both downloading and inference of local LLM models.
* Users are eager for a solution to avoid relying on cloud LLMs.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Account Linking and Service Errors
common_issues.description: Users report issues with linking multiple accounts (Google, GitHub) and accessing services like Copilot. Temporary solutions involve manual linking or waiting for a new account linking flow. Service errors often lack specific details, leading to generic troubleshooting suggestions and requests for follow-up from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @johnkennyuk reported an issue with account linking.
* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and a replacement is being actively developed.
* A temporary solution is offered by @mark-at-pieces to manually link accounts.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking process is not straightforward and user-friendly. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A new account linking flow is being developed and will be released in mid-to-late February.
* A temporary solution is offered by @mark-at-pieces to manually link accounts through a scheduled meeting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new account linking flow is under development.
* Users can contact @mark-at-pieces for a temporary solution.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue author was directed to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.
